summary: Node.js Docker Build Fixes for Alpine Targets

message.content: Create a PR explaining that this was breaking the publish workflow

content.text: I'll create a PR explaining the fix for the publish workflow. Let me first examine the recent commit and understand what was breaking.

input.description: Check recent commits to understand the fix

input.description: See the actual changes made to fix the publish workflow

content.content:
On branch fix-publish2
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/fix-publish2'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

toolUseResult.stdout:
On branch fix-publish2
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/fix-publish2'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

input.command:
git push origin fix-publish2 && gh pr create --title "chore(repo): fix publish workflow" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Current Behavior

The publish workflow was failing because the preinstall script was exiting with code 1 when detecting an older Node.js version, causing the entire publishing process to fail.

## Expected Behavior  

The preinstall script should warn about Node.js version requirements but not exit with an error code during publishing, allowing the workflow to continue.

## Related Issue(s)

This fixes a critical issue preventing package publishing due to Node.js version check failures in CI environments.

The fix changes:
- `console.error()` to `console.warn()` for better log categorization
- Removes `process.exit(1)` to prevent workflow termination  
- Adds the actual Node.js version to the warning message for better debugging

This ensures the publish workflow can complete successfully while still providing visibility into Node.js version mismatches.
EOF
)"
input.description: Push branch and create PR with detailed explanation

content.text:
Perfect! The PR has been successfully created. The fix changes the preinstall script to use `console.warn()` instead of `console.error()` and removes the `process.exit(1)` that was causing the publish workflow to fail.

The PR explains that this was preventing package publishing in CI environments where Node.js version requirements weren't met, but the publishing should still continue with just a warning.

PR created: https://github.com/nrwl/nx/pull/31510
